questions.title: Question 1
questions.question_text: Detecting a change in hospital infection rates" is a scenario of Conversational Al.
questions.question_html: Detecting a change in hospital infection rates" is a scenario of Conversational Al.
questions.answer_html:
• A. False
  • B. True
questions.explanation_en:
Detecting a change in hospital infection rates is an analytics or anomaly-detection scenario, not a conversational AI scenario. Conversational AI covers systems that hold a dialog with users, such as chatbots or voice agents. Here you are analysing numeric data over time, not engaging in conversation.

Microsoft Learn documentation:
- https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/ai-services/anomaly-detector/overview
- https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/ai-services/metrics-advisor/overview

questions.title: Question 2
questions.question_text: You are testing a machine learning model. How should you split data for training and evaluation?
questions.question_html: You are testing a machine learning model. How should you split data for training and evaluation?
questions.answer_html:
• A. Use features for training and labels for evaluation.
  • B. Randomly split the data into some rows for training and remaining rows for evaluation.
  • C. Use labels for training and features for evaluation.
  • D. Randomly split the data into columns for training and columns for evaluation.

choices.label: A
choices.text: Use features for training and labels for evaluation.
choices.raw: A. Use features for training and labels for evaluation.

choices.label: B
choices.text: Randomly split the data into some rows for training and remaining rows for evaluation.
choices.raw: B. Randomly split the data into some rows for training and remaining rows for evaluation.

choices.label: C
choices.text: Use labels for training and features for evaluation.
choices.raw: C. Use labels for training and features for evaluation.

choices.label: D
choices.text: Randomly split the data into columns for training and columns for evaluation.
choices.raw: D. Randomly split the data into columns for training and columns for evaluation.

questions.explanation_en:
To evaluate a machine learning model fairly you must test it on examples it has not seen during training. The typical approach is to randomly split the rows of your dataset into a training set and a separate evaluation set. Using features vs. labels for training/evaluation or splitting by columns would break the learning process.

Microsoft Learn documentation:
- https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/credentials/certifications/resources/study-guides/ai-900
- https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/training/paths/introduction-to-ai-on-azure/

questions.title: Question 3
questions.question_text: Drag and Drop the Microsoft guiding principles for responsible Al (on the left) to the appropriate description (on the right)
questions.question_html: Drag and Drop the Microsoft guiding principles for responsible Al (on the left) to the appropriate description (on the right)
questions.answer_html:
Fairness
Accountability
Reliability and safety
Privacy and security

Implementing processes to ensure that decisions made by the Al system can be overridden by humans.


Ensure that Al system operates as they were originally designed, respond to unanticipated conditions, and resist harmful manipulations.


Provides consumers with information and controls over the collection use and storage of their data

Accountability
Reliability and safety
Privacy and security
questions.explanation_en:
The Microsoft guiding principles for responsible AI are Fairness, Reliability & Safety, Privacy & Security, Inclusiveness, Transparency, and Accountability. Each description in the question should be matched to one of these principles, for example, avoiding discrimination relates to Fairness, protecting personal data to Privacy & Security, and making systems understandable to Transparency.

Microsoft Learn documentation:
- https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/machine-learning/concept-responsible-ai?view=azureml-api-2
- https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/training/modules/apply-responsible-ai-principles/

questions.title: Question 4
questions.question_text: Your team member is planning to use the Form Recognizer pre-built receipt model. Which kind of Azure resource should you recommend to create?
questions.question_html: Your team member is planning to use the Form Recognizer pre-built receipt model. Which kind of Azure resource should you recommend to create?
questions.answer_html:
• A. Face Service
  • B. Form Recognizer
  • C. Computer Vision
questions.explanation_en:
The prebuilt receipt model is part of Azure AI Document Intelligence, previously known as Form Recognizer. To use this model you must create a Form Recognizer (Document Intelligence) resource, not a Face or Computer Vision resource. That resource exposes the receipt endpoint that extracts key fields such as merchant, date, and totals from receipts.

Microsoft Learn documentation:
- https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/ai-services/document-intelligence/overview?view=doc-intel-4.0.0
- https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/training/modules/work-form-recognizer/
- https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/ai-services/computer-vision/overview

questions.title: Question 5
questions.question_text: You are developing a system, that scans the news for articles about your customers and alert employees when there is a negative article. Positive articles must be added to a press book. Which natural language processing tasks should you use to complete the process?
questions.question_html:
You are developing a system, that scans the news for articles about your customers and alert employees when there is a negative article. Positive articles must be added to a press book.

Which natural language processing tasks should you use to complete the process?
questions.answer_html:
• A. Entity Recognition
  • B. Translation
  • C. Speech Synthesis
  • D. Sentiment Analysis
questions.explanation_en:
The scenario has two tasks: finding mentions of your company in text and determining whether the news is positive or negative. Named Entity Recognition finds entities such as organization names in text, while Sentiment Analysis scores the overall attitude of the text as positive, neutral, or negative. Key phrase extraction and translation do not directly address these goals.

Microsoft Learn documentation:
- https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/ai-services/language-service/overview
- https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/ai-services/language-service/sentiment-opinion-mining/overview
- https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/training/modules/analyze-text-ai-language/

questions.title: Question 6
questions.question_text: Select the correct use case from provided scenarios for classification?
questions.question_html: Select the correct use case from provided scenarios for classification?
questions.answer_html:
• A. predicting how many cups of coffee a person will drink based on how many hours the person slept the previous night.
  • B. predicting how many minutes it will take someone to run a race based on past race times.
  • C. predicting whether someone uses a bicycle to travel to work based on the distance from home to work.
  • D. analyzing the contents of images and grouping images that have similar colors.

choices.label: A
choices.text: predicting how many cups of coffee a person will drink based on how many hours the person slept the previous night.
choices.raw: A. predicting how many cups of coffee a person will drink based on how many hours the person slept the previous night.

choices.label: B
choices.text: predicting how many minutes it will take someone to run a race based on past race times.
choices.raw: B. predicting how many minutes it will take someone to run a race based on past race times.

choices.label: C
choices.text: predicting whether someone uses a bicycle to travel to work based on the distance from home to work.
choices.raw: C. predicting whether someone uses a bicycle to travel to work based on the distance from home to work.

choices.label: D
choices.text: analyzing the contents of images and grouping images that have similar colors.
choices.raw: D. analyzing the contents of images and grouping images that have similar colors.

questions.explanation_en:
Classification problems predict a discrete label such as yes/no or a category. Predicting whether someone uses a bicycle to travel to work is a yes/no decision based on features like distance, so it is a classification task. Predicting a number such as minutes of travel or cups of coffee is regression, and grouping similar items without labels is clustering.

Microsoft Learn documentation:
- https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/training/modules/train-evaluate-classification-models/
- https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/machine-learning/tutorial-designer-automobile-price-train-score?view=azureml-api-1

questions.title: Question 7
questions.question_text: Which Azure OpenAl model can generate original images from natural language?
questions.question_html: Which Azure OpenAl model can generate original images from natural language?
questions.answer_html:
• A. DALL-E
  • B. Whisper
  • C. Embeddings
  • D. GPT3.5
  • E. GPT-4
questions.explanation_en:
DALL-E (and its successor GPT-image-1 in Azure) is the model designed to generate original images from natural language prompts. Whisper is used for speech-to-text, embeddings models create vector representations of text, and GPT-3.5/4 are primarily text and code models. Therefore only DALL-E fits the requirement of image generation from text.

Microsoft Learn documentation:
- https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/ai-foundry/openai/overview
- https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/ai-foundry/openai/concepts/understand-embeddings
- https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/ai-foundry/openai/tutorials/embeddings

questions.title: Question 8
questions.question_text: You have a dataset. You need to build an Azure Machine Learning classification model that will identify defective products. What should you do first?
questions.question_html: You have a dataset. You need to build an Azure Machine Learning classification model that will identify defective products. What should you do first?
questions.answer_html:
• A. Create a clustering model.
  • B. Split the data into training and testing datasets.
  • C. Create a classification model.
  • D. Load the dataset.

choices.label: B
choices.text: Split the data into training and testing datasets.
choices.raw: B. Split the data into training and testing datasets.

questions.explanation_en:
Before you can configure training you must first load your dataset into Azure Machine Learning. Once the data is available in the workspace or Designer, you can split it into training and test subsets, choose algorithms, and start training runs. Without loading data, none of the later steps are possible.

Microsoft Learn documentation:
- https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/machine-learning/concept-designer?view=azureml-api-2
- https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/machine-learning/tutorial-designer-automobile-price-train-score?view=azureml-api-1
- https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/training/modules/train-evaluate-classification-models/

questions.title: Question 9
questions.question_text: You are developing an Al system and encountered a situation where the Al system should be ingested with unusual and missing values. Which Microsoft guiding principle for responsible Al you should consider?
questions.question_html: You are developing an Al system and encountered a situation where the Al system should be ingested with unusual and missing values. Which Microsoft guiding principle for responsible Al you should consider?
questions.answer_html:
• A. Inclusiveness
  • B. Reliability and Safety
  • C. Fairness
questions.explanation_en:
Reliability and Safety focus on ensuring that AI systems behave safely and predictably, especially under unusual conditions such as missing or abnormal input data. In such cases the system may need to refuse to return a prediction or trigger additional checks rather than silently producing unreliable output. That is exactly the concern described in the scenario.

Microsoft Learn documentation:
- https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/machine-learning/concept-responsible-ai?view=azureml-api-2
- https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/training/modules/apply-responsible-ai-principles/

questions.title: Question 11
questions.question_text: Match the Microsoft guidance for responsible generative Al stages with their appropriate definition.
questions.question_html: Match the Microsoft guidance for responsible generative Al stages with their appropriate definition.
questions.answer_html:
Identify
Operate
Measure
Mitigate

the presence of these harms in the outputs generated by your solution.


the harms at multiple layers in your solution to minimize their presence and impact, and ensure transparent communication about potential risks to users.


potential harms that are relevant to your planned solution.


the solution responsibly by defining and following a deployment and operational readiness plan.

Measure
Mitigate
Identify
Operate
questions.explanation_en:
Microsoft’s responsible generative AI process can be summarised as Identify, Measure, Mitigate, and Operate. You first identify potential harms and risks, then measure how often they occur, apply mitigations such as filters or data changes, and finally operate the system with ongoing monitoring and governance. The definitions in the question map to these four stages.

Microsoft Learn documentation:
- https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/credentials/certifications/resources/study-guides/ai-900
- https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/training/paths/introduction-to-ai-on-azure/

questions.title: Question 12
questions.question_text: You have a frequently asked questions (FAQ) PDF file and need to create a conversational support system based on the FAQ. Which service should you use?
questions.question_html: You have a frequently asked questions (FAQ) PDF file and need to create a conversational support system based on the FAQ. Which service should you use?
questions.answer_html:
• A. Text Analytics
  • B. Language Understanding (LUIS)
  • C. Computer Vision
  • D. QnA Maker
questions.explanation_en:
If you have an FAQ document and want a chatbot to answer questions with predefined answers, the classic Azure service is QnA Maker, now the Question Answering feature of Azure AI Language. It ingests a PDF or web page, builds a knowledge base of question–answer pairs, and exposes it via an API that a bot can call. Computer Vision or Form Recognizer process documents, but they do not provide a Q&A experience by themselves.

Microsoft Learn documentation:
- https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/ai-services/document-intelligence/overview?view=doc-intel-4.0.0
- https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/training/modules/work-form-recognizer/
- https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/ai-services/language-service/question-answering/overview

questions.title: Question 13
questions.question_text: Answering frequently asked questions" is a scenario of Conversational Al.
questions.question_html: Answering frequently asked questions" is a scenario of Conversational Al.
questions.answer_html:
• A. True
  • B. False
questions.explanation_en:
Answering frequently asked questions in natural language is one of the most common Conversational AI scenarios. A user asks a question through chat or voice, and a bot or copilot responds with an appropriate answer. That is exactly what FAQ bots built with Azure Bot Service, Copilot Studio, or Azure AI Language are designed to do.

Microsoft Learn documentation:
- https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/ai-services/language-service/question-answering/overview
- https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/training/modules/create-question-answer-solution-ai-language/

questions.title: Question 14
questions.question_text: Extracting key insights from structured and unstructured data sources is a feature of what type of workload? Select the correct option.
questions.question_html: Extracting key insights from structured and unstructured data sources is a feature of what type of workload? Select the correct option.
questions.answer_html:
• A. Anomaly detection
  • B. Knowledge Mining
  • C. Computer Vision
  • D. Natural Language Processing
questions.explanation_en:
Knowledge mining is the workload focused on extracting insights from large volumes of structured and unstructured data. Solutions are typically built with Azure AI Search and cognitive skills to pull key information, entities, and relationships out of documents and databases. Computer vision, NLP, and other services can be used inside a knowledge-mining pipeline, but the overall scenario described matches knowledge mining.

Microsoft Learn documentation:
- https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/ai-services/computer-vision/overview
- https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/ai-services/computer-vision/overview-image-analysis
- https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/search/search-what-is-azure-search

questions.title: Question 15
questions.question_text: You have an Azure Machine Learning pipeline that contains a Split Data module. The Split Data module outputs to a Train Model module and a Score Model module. What is the function of the Split Data module?
questions.question_html: You have an Azure Machine Learning pipeline that contains a Split Data module. The Split Data module outputs to a Train Model module and a Score Model module. What is the function of the Split Data module?
questions.answer_html:
• A. Selecting columns that must be included in the model.
  • B. Scaling numeric variables so that they are within a consistent numeric range.
  • C. Creating training and validation datasets.
  • D. Diverting records that have missing data.

choices.label: A
choices.text: Selecting columns that must be included in the model.
choices.raw: A. Selecting columns that must be included in the model.

choices.label: B
choices.text: Scaling numeric variables so that they are within a consistent numeric range.
choices.raw: B. Scaling numeric variables so that they are within a consistent numeric range.

choices.label: C
choices.raw: C. Creating training and validation datasets.

choices.label: D
choices.text: Diverting records that have missing data.
choices.raw: D. Diverting records that have missing data.

questions.explanation_en:
In Azure Machine Learning designer, the Split Data component is used to divide your dataset into subsets, most commonly a training set and a validation or test set. This allows you to train the model on one subset and evaluate its performance on a separate subset. It does not normalise features, select algorithms, or evaluate the model directly.

Microsoft Learn documentation:
- https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/machine-learning/concept-designer?view=azureml-api-2
- https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/machine-learning/tutorial-designer-automobile-price-train-score?view=azureml-api-1

questions.title: Question 16
questions.question_text: You need to reduce the load on telephone operators by implementing a chatbot to answer simple questions with predefined answers. Which two Al service should you use to achieve the goal?
questions.question_html: You need to reduce the load on telephone operators by implementing a chatbot to answer simple questions with predefined answers. Which two Al service should you use to achieve the goal?
questions.answer_html:
• A. Text Analytics
  • B. Azure Bot Service
  • C. QnA Maker
  • D. Translator
questions.explanation_en:
To reduce the load on telephone operators with a simple FAQ-style chatbot, you typically combine Azure Bot Service with QnA Maker (Question Answering in Azure AI Language). Azure Bot Service hosts the bot and connects it to channels like web chat or telephony, while QnA Maker provides the knowledge base of predefined questions and answers. Form Recognizer and Computer Vision are not designed for FAQ chat.

Microsoft Learn documentation:
- https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/ai-services/document-intelligence/overview?view=doc-intel-4.0.0
- https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/training/modules/work-form-recognizer/
- https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/ai-services/language-service/question-answering/overview

questions.title: Question 17
questions.question_text: Which statement is an example of a Microsoft responsible Al principle? Select the correct option.
questions.question_html: Which statement is an example of a Microsoft responsible Al principle? Select the correct option.
questions.answer_html:
• A. Al systems must be transparent and inclusive.
  • B. Al systems must use only publicly available data.
  • C. Al systems must protect the interests of the company.
  • D. Al systems must keep personal details public.

choices.label: A
choices.text: Al systems must be transparent and inclusive.
choices.raw: A. Al systems must be transparent and inclusive.

choices.label: B
choices.text: Al systems must use only publicly available data.
choices.raw: B. Al systems must use only publicly available data.

choices.label: C
choices.text: Al systems must protect the interests of the company.
choices.raw: C. Al systems must protect the interests of the company.

choices.label: D
choices.text: Al systems must keep personal details public.
choices.raw: D. Al systems must keep personal details public.

questions.explanation_en:
Two of Microsoft’s responsible AI principles are Transparency and Inclusiveness. Transparency means that users can understand how the system works, what data it uses, and what its limitations are. Inclusiveness means designing AI to empower and include people with diverse abilities and backgrounds, rather than excluding them.

Microsoft Learn documentation:
- https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/machine-learning/concept-responsible-ai?view=azureml-api-2
- https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/training/modules/apply-responsible-ai-principles/

questions.title: Question 18
questions.question_text: What can be used to build no-code apps that use built-in natural language processing models. Select the answer that correctly completes the sentence.
questions.question_html: What can be used to build no-code apps that use built-in natural language processing models. Select the answer that correctly completes the sentence.
questions.answer_html:
• A. Microsoft Copilot Studio
  • B. Microsoft Bot Framework
  • C. Azure Health Bot
questions.explanation_en:
Microsoft Copilot Studio is a no-code or low-code tool for building conversational apps that use built-in natural language processing models. It allows you to define topics, intents, and responses visually without writing code, and can connect to your data. Bot Framework is a code-first SDK, and Azure Health Bot is a specialised medical scenario, not a general no-code NLP app builder.

Microsoft Learn documentation:
- https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/credentials/certifications/resources/study-guides/ai-900
- https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/training/paths/introduction-to-ai-on-azure/

questions.title: Question 19
questions.question_text: Which Azure Cognitive Services service can be used to identify documents that contain sensitive information? Select the correct option.
questions.question_html: Which Azure Cognitive Services service can be used to identify documents that contain sensitive information? Select the correct option.
questions.answer_html:
• A. Custom Vision
  • B. Form Recognizer
  • C. Conversational Language Understanding
questions.explanation_en:
Azure AI Document Intelligence (Form Recognizer) can analyse documents such as forms, invoices, and contracts, extract structured fields, and thus help you detect whether they contain sensitive information like names, addresses, or ID numbers. Custom Vision works on images for classification and object detection, and Conversational Language Understanding focuses on user utterances in dialogs, not full documents.

Microsoft Learn documentation:
- https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/ai-services/document-intelligence/overview?view=doc-intel-4.0.0
- https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/training/modules/work-form-recognizer/
- https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/ai-services/custom-vision-service/overview

questions.title: Question 20
questions.question_text: A banking system, that predicts whether a loan will be repaid or not, is an example of what type of machine learning? Select the correct option.
questions.question_html: A banking system, that predicts whether a loan will be repaid or not, is an example of what type of machine learning? Select the correct option.
questions.answer_html:
• A. classification
  • B. regression
  • C. clustering
questions.explanation_en:
A system that predicts whether a loan will be repaid or not is performing a classification task because the output is a discrete label such as 'will default' or 'will be repaid'. Regression would predict a numeric value such as the exact loss amount, and clustering would group similar customers without pre-defined labels. Therefore classification is the correct type of machine learning.

Microsoft Learn documentation:
- https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/training/modules/train-evaluate-classification-models/
- https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/machine-learning/tutorial-designer-automobile-price-train-score?view=azureml-api-1

questions.title: Question 21
questions.question_text: Your website use a chatbot to assist customers, and it need to detect when a customer is upset based on what the customer types when interacting with chatbot. Which type of Al workload should you use?
questions.question_html: Your website use a chatbot to assist customers, and it need to detect when a customer is upset based on what the customer types when interacting with chatbot. Which type of Al workload should you use?
questions.answer_html:
• A. regression
  • B. natural language processing
  • C. anomaly detection
  • D. computer vision
questions.explanation_en:
The chatbot must understand the emotional tone in what the user types and detect when the user is upset. This is a natural language processing workload because it involves analysing text to infer sentiment or emotion. Regression and anomaly detection are numeric modelling techniques, and computer vision is for images and video, not for analysing typed text.

Microsoft Learn documentation:
- https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/ai-services/language-service/overview
- https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/ai-services/language-service/sentiment-opinion-mining/overview
- https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/training/modules/analyze-text-ai-language/

questions.title: Question 22
questions.question_text: You are authoring a Language Understanding (LUIS) application to support a music festival. You want users to be able to ask questions about scheduled shows, such as, "Which act is playing on the main stage?" The question "Which act is playing on the main stage?" is an example of which type of element?
questions.question_html: You are authoring a Language Understanding (LUIS) application to support a music festival. You want users to be able to ask questions about scheduled shows, such as, "Which act is playing on the main stage?" The question "Which act is playing on the main stage?" is an example of which type of element?
questions.answer_html:
• A. an intent
  • B. an utterance
  • C. an entity
  • D. a domain
questions.explanation_en:
In a Language Understanding (LUIS) or conversational model, an utterance is a specific sentence or phrase that a user might say, such as 'Which act is playing on the main stage?'. Intents represent the goal behind many utterances (for example, 'GetShowSchedule'), and entities represent key data within utterances, such as 'main stage' or a date. Therefore the given question is an utterance.

Microsoft Learn documentation:
- https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/credentials/certifications/resources/study-guides/ai-900
- https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/training/paths/introduction-to-ai-on-azure/

questions.question_text: Select the correct scenarios, where you will use the Form Recognizer service. Select two correct options.
questions.question_html: Select the correct scenarios, where you will use the Form Recognizer service. Select two correct options.
questions.answer_html:
• A. Extracting the invoice number from an invoice.
  • B. Identifying the retailer from a receipt.
  • C. Finding image of product in a catalog.
  • D. Translate a form from French to English.

choices.text: Extracting the invoice number from an invoice.
choices.raw: A. Extracting the invoice number from an invoice.

choices.label: B

choices.raw: B. Identifying the retailer from a receipt.

choices.label: C
choices.text: Finding image of product in a catalog.
choices.raw: C. Finding image of product in a catalog.

choices.label: D
choices.text: Translate a form from French to English.
choices.raw: D. Translate a form from French to English.

questions.explanation_en:
Azure AI Document Intelligence (Form Recognizer) is used to extract structured data from forms, invoices, and receipts. Extracting an invoice number from an invoice and identifying the retailer from a receipt are exactly the kinds of fields that Form Recognizer can read automatically. Finding a product image or translating between languages are handled by other services such as Custom Vision or Translator.

Microsoft Learn documentation:
- https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/ai-services/document-intelligence/overview?view=doc-intel-4.0.0
- https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/training/modules/work-form-recognizer/
- https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/ai-services/custom-vision-service/overview

questions.title: Question 24
questions.question_text: Azure Machine Learning designer can be used to create machine learning models by Select the answer that correctly completes the sentence.
questions.question_html: Azure Machine Learning designer can be used to create machine learning models by Select the answer that correctly completes the sentence.
questions.answer_html:
• A. Automatically selecting an algorithm to build the most accurate model.
  • B. Automatically performing common data preparation tasks.
  • C. Adding and connecting modules on a visual canvas.
  • D. Using a code-first notebook experience.

choices.label: A
choices.text: Automatically selecting an algorithm to build the most accurate model.
choices.raw: A. Automatically selecting an algorithm to build the most accurate model.

choices.label: B
choices.text: Automatically performing common data preparation tasks.
choices.raw: B. Automatically performing common data preparation tasks.

choices.label: C
choices.text: Adding and connecting modules on a visual canvas.
choices.raw: C. Adding and connecting modules on a visual canvas.

choices.label: D
choices.raw: D. Using a code-first notebook experience.

questions.explanation_en:
Azure Machine Learning designer is a low-code, drag-and-drop interface for building machine learning pipelines visually. You add modules such as data input, Split Data, Train Model, and Evaluate Model onto a canvas and connect them. Auto-selecting algorithms or performing data prep automatically is the role of automated ML, and code-first notebooks use Python or R directly rather than Designer's visual interface.

Microsoft Learn documentation:
- https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/ai-services/language-service/overview
- https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/ai-services/language-service/sentiment-opinion-mining/overview

questions.title: Question 25
questions.question_text: You are using drones to identify where weeds grow between rows of crops to send an instruction for the removal of the weeds. This is an example of which type of computer vision?
questions.question_html: You are using drones to identify where weeds grow between rows of crops to send an instruction for the removal of the weeds. This is an example of which type of computer vision?
questions.answer_html:
• A. scene segmentation
  • B. optical character recognition (OCR)
  • C. object detection
questions.explanation_en:
The scenario describes using images from drones to find where weeds are growing between rows of crops. The task is to locate specific objects (weeds) within an image, not just recognise that an image contains weeds overall. This is object detection: identifying and drawing bounding boxes around instances of an object. Scene segmentation and image classification do not give object-level locations, and OCR is only for text.

Microsoft Learn documentation:
- https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/ai-services/custom-vision-service/overview
- https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/ai-services/custom-vision-service/getting-started-build-a-classifier
- https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/ai-services/computer-vision/overview

questions.title: Question 26
questions.question_text: HOTSPOT For each of the following statements, select Yes if the statement is true. Otherwise, select No. Note: Each correct selection is worth one point. Hot Area:
questions.question_html:

Statement

A webchat bot can interact with users visiting a website.

Automatically generating captions for pre-recorded videos is an example of conversational Al.

A smart device in the home that responds to questions such as "What will the weather be like today?" is an example of conversational Al.
questions.explanation_en:
Facial recognition workloads can be grouped into verification, identification, and grouping. Verification answers the question 'Is this the claimed person?' and compares one face to another. Identification finds which person from a known gallery best matches a given face. Grouping, sometimes called clustering, organises unknown faces into groups based on visual similarity. The HOTSPOT question maps each scenario to one of these three facial recognition tasks.

Microsoft Learn documentation:
- https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/ai-services/computer-vision/overview-identity
- https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/ai-services/computer-vision/concept-face-recognition

questions.title: Question 27
questions.question_text: Match the facial recognition tasks to the appropriate scenario.
questions.question_html: Match the facial recognition tasks to the appropriate scenario.
questions.answer_html:
Identification
Grouping
Similarity
Verification

Do two images of a face belong to the same person?


Does this person look like other people?


Do all the faces belong together?


Who is this person in this group of people?

Verification
Similarity
Grouping
Identification
questions.explanation_en:
In the matching facial recognition tasks question, verification refers to confirming that a face matches a specific person, such as unlocking a phone. Identification refers to searching a collection of known faces to find a match, such as looking for a suspect in a watchlist. Grouping clusters together faces that look alike when there is no prior identity information, for example grouping holiday photos by who appears in them.

Microsoft Learn documentation:
- https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/ai-services/computer-vision/overview-identity
- https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/ai-services/computer-vision/concept-face-recognition

questions.title: Question 28
questions.question_text: Making a travel reservation" is a scenario of Conversational Al.
questions.question_html: Making a travel reservation" is a scenario of Conversational Al.
questions.answer_html:
• A. True
  • B. False
questions.explanation_en:
Making a travel reservation through a conversational interface is a classic Conversational AI scenario. The user interacts with a chatbot or voice assistant, provides details such as dates and destinations, and the system guides them through the booking process using natural language. This is different from background analytics or batch processing and squarely fits conversational workloads.

Microsoft Learn documentation:
- https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/credentials/certifications/resources/study-guides/ai-900
- https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/training/paths/introduction-to-ai-on-azure/

questions.title: Question 29
questions.question_text: You are developing a chatbot solution in Azure. Which service should you use to determine a user's intent?
questions.question_html: You are developing a chatbot solution in Azure. Which service should you use to determine a user's intent?
questions.answer_html:
• A. Speech
  • B. QnA Maker
  • C. Translator
  • D. Language Understanding (LUIS)
questions.explanation_en:
Language Understanding (LUIS) is the Azure service used to detect a user's intent and extract entities from what they say or type. Speech can be used first to convert spoken audio to text, QnA Maker handles question–answer pairs, and Translator handles language translation, but the component that recognises intents like 'BookFlight' or 'CheckBalance' is Language Understanding.

Microsoft Learn documentation:
- https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/ai-services/language-service/question-answering/overview
- https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/training/modules/create-question-answer-solution-ai-language/
- https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/bot-service/bot-service-channels-reference?view=azure-bot-service-4.0

questions.title: Question 30
questions.question_text: What are the Microsoft guiding principles for responsible Al? Select three correct options.
questions.question_html: What are the Microsoft guiding principles for responsible Al? Select three correct options.
questions.answer_html:
• A. Fairness
  • B. Knowledgeability
  • C. Reliability and Safety
  • D. Inclusiveness
questions.explanation_en:
Microsoft's responsible AI principles include Fairness, Reliability and Safety, Privacy and Security, Inclusiveness, Transparency, and Accountability. Among the options given, Fairness, Reliability and Safety, and Inclusiveness are actual named principles. 'Knowledgeability' is not one of the official Microsoft responsible AI principles, so it should not be selected.

Microsoft Learn documentation:
- https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/machine-learning/concept-responsible-ai?view=azureml-api-2
- https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/training/modules/apply-responsible-ai-principles/

questions.title: Question 31
questions.question_text: You are developing a mobile app for employees to scan and store their expenses while travelling. Which type of computer vision should you use?
questions.question_html: You are developing a mobile app for employees to scan and store their expenses while travelling. Which type of computer vision should you use?
questions.answer_html:
• A. Optical Character Recognition (OCR)
  • B. Object detection
  • C. Facial detection
  • D. Image classification
questions.explanation_en:
For a mobile app that lets employees scan and store expense receipts, you need to read the text from images of receipts. This is an Optical Character Recognition (OCR) scenario, where printed text in an image is converted into machine-readable text. Object detection, facial detection, and image classification focus on recognising objects or faces, not on extracting text content from documents.

Microsoft Learn documentation:
- https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/ai-services/document-intelligence/overview?view=doc-intel-4.0.0
- https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/training/modules/work-form-recognizer/
- https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/ai-services/custom-vision-service/overview

questions.title: Question 32
questions.question_text: What metrics you can use to evaluate a regression model? Select two correct options.
questions.question_html: What metrics you can use to evaluate a regression model? Select two correct options.
questions.answer_html:
• A. F1 score
  • B. area under curve (AUC)
  • C. root mean squared error (RMSE)
  • D. coefficient of determination (R2)
questions.explanation_en:
Regression models predict continuous numeric values, so you evaluate them with metrics designed for numeric error, such as root mean squared error (RMSE) and coefficient of determination (R²). RMSE measures the average magnitude of prediction errors, and R² measures how much variance in the target is explained by the model. F1 score and AUC are classification metrics, not regression metrics.

Microsoft Learn documentation:
- https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/training/modules/train-evaluate-classification-models/
- https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/machine-learning/tutorial-designer-automobile-price-train-score?view=azureml-api-1

questions.title: Question 33
questions.question_text: HOTSPOT For each of the following statements, select Yes if the statement is true. Otherwise, select No. Note: Each correct selection is worth one point. Hot Area:
questions.question_html:
HOTSPOT

For each of the following statements, select Yes if the statement is true. Otherwise, select No.

Note: Each correct selection is worth one point.

Hot Area:
questions.answer_html:
Answer Area

Statement

Yes

No

Labelling is the process of tagging training data with known values.

You should evaluate a model by using the same data used to train the model.

Accuracy is always the primary metric used to measure a model's performance.
questions.explanation_en:
The HOTSPOT question on labelling and model evaluation covers basic ML practices. Labelling is indeed the process of tagging training data with known target values. However, you should not evaluate a model on the same data used to train it, because that overestimates performance; you need separate validation or test data. Accuracy is not always the primary metric because in imbalanced or specialised scenarios other metrics such as precision, recall, F1, or AUC may be more appropriate.

Microsoft Learn documentation:
- https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/machine-learning/component-reference/evaluate-model?view=azureml-api-2

questions.title: Question 34
questions.question_text: You need to map the right type of natural language processing workload for following scenario: Be able to evaluate text along with a positive-negative scale Which of the following would you map to this requirement?
questions.question_html:
You need to map the right type of natural language processing workload for following scenario:
Be able to evaluate text along with a positive-negative scale


Which of the following would you map to this requirement?
questions.answer_html:
• A. Language modeling
  • B. Sentiment analysis
  • C. Key phrase extraction
  • D. Translation
questions.explanation_en:
The requirement is to evaluate text on a positive–negative scale, which is exactly what sentiment analysis does. It assigns scores or labels such as positive, neutral, and negative based on the emotional tone of the text. Language modelling predicts likely sequences of words, key phrase extraction finds important terms, and translation converts text between languages, but none of those directly produce a positive–negative sentiment score.

Microsoft Learn documentation:
- https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/ai-services/language-service/overview
- https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/ai-services/language-service/sentiment-opinion-mining/overview
- https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/training/modules/analyze-text-ai-language/

questions.title: Question 35
questions.question_text: You are using the Text analytics service to perform sentiment analysis on a document. The service returned a score of 0.5 What does this score indicate about the document sentiment?
questions.question_html: You are using the Text analytics service to perform sentiment analysis on a document. The service returned a score of 0.5 What does this score indicate about the document sentiment?
questions.answer_html:
• A. The document is positive
  • B. The document is negative
  • C. The document is neutral
questions.explanation_en:
In Azure Text Analytics sentiment analysis, scores typically range from 0 to 1, where values closer to 0 indicate negative sentiment, values closer to 1 indicate positive sentiment, and values around the middle of the range indicate neutral sentiment. A score of 0.5 therefore suggests that the document is overall neutral rather than clearly positive or negative.

Microsoft Learn documentation:
- https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/ai-services/language-service/overview
- https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/ai-services/language-service/sentiment-opinion-mining/overview
- https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/training/modules/analyze-text-ai-language/

questions.title: Question 36
questions.question_text: You are building an Al-based app and need to ensure that the app uses the principles for responsible Al. Which two principles should you follow?
questions.question_html: You are building an Al-based app and need to ensure that the app uses the principles for responsible Al. Which two principles should you follow?
questions.answer_html:
• A. Establish a risk governance committee that includes members of the legal team, members of the risk management team, and a privacy officer.
  • B. Implement an Agile software development methodology.
  • C. Implement a process of Al model validation as part of the software review process.
  • D. Prevent the disclosure of the use of Al-based algorithms for automated decision making.

choices.label: A
choices.text: Establish a risk governance committee that includes members of the legal team, members of the risk management team, and a privacy officer.
choices.raw: A. Establish a risk governance committee that includes members of the legal team, members of the risk management team, and a privacy officer.

choices.label: B
choices.text: Implement an Agile software development methodology.
choices.raw: B. Implement an Agile software development methodology.

choices.label: C
choices.text: Implement a process of Al model validation as part of the software review process.
choices.raw: C. Implement a process of Al model validation as part of the software review process.

choices.label: D
choices.text: Prevent the disclosure of the use of Al-based algorithms for automated decision making.
choices.raw: D. Prevent the disclosure of the use of Al-based algorithms for automated decision making.

questions.explanation_en:
Responsible AI requires both governance and validation. Establishing a risk governance committee that includes legal, risk management, and privacy representatives ensures oversight and accountability for AI use. Implementing a process of AI model validation as part of the software review process ensures that models are tested for quality, fairness, and compliance before deployment. Agile methods are about development process, and hiding the use of AI conflicts with transparency principles.

Microsoft Learn documentation:
- https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/machine-learning/concept-responsible-ai?view=azureml-api-2
- https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/training/modules/apply-responsible-ai-principles/

questions.title: Question 37
questions.question_text: You decided to use the Computer Vision service to analyze set of images, which has locations, to identify well-known buildings. What should you do?
questions.question_html: You decided to use the Computer Vision service to analyze set of images, which has locations, to identify well-known buildings. What should you do?
questions.answer_html:
• A. Retrieve the categories for the image, specifying the landmarks domain.
  • B. Retrieve the categories for the image, specifying the celebrities domain.
  • C. Retrieve the objects in the image.

choices.label: A
choices.text: Retrieve the categories for the image, specifying the landmarks domain.
choices.raw: A. Retrieve the categories for the image, specifying the landmarks domain.

choices.label: B
choices.text: Retrieve the categories for the image, specifying the celebrities domain.
choices.raw: B. Retrieve the categories for the image, specifying the celebrities domain.

choices.label: C
choices.text: Retrieve the objects in the image.
choices.raw: C. Retrieve the objects in the image.

questions.explanation_en:
If you want to identify famous buildings in photos that include locations, you can use the Computer Vision service's domain-specific models for landmarks. By requesting image analysis with the 'landmarks' domain, the service will attempt to recognise well-known buildings and landmarks and return their names. The 'celebrities' domain focuses on famous people, and generic object detection does not have specialised landmark knowledge.

Microsoft Learn documentation:
- https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/ai-services/computer-vision/overview
- https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/ai-services/computer-vision/overview-image-analysis

questions.title: Question 38
questions.question_text: You have a website that includes customer reviews. You need to store the reviews in English and present the reviews to users in their respective language by recognizing each user's geographical location. Which type of natural language processing workload should you use?
questions.question_html: You have a website that includes customer reviews. You need to store the reviews in English and present the reviews to users in their respective language by recognizing each user's geographical location. Which type of natural language processing workload should you use?
questions.answer_html:
• A. Translation
  • B. Speech recognition
  • C. Key phrase extraction
questions.explanation_en:
In this scenario you store customer reviews in English but need to present them to users in their own language based on where they are. That is a translation workload: you translate the English text into the target language at runtime. Speech recognition would convert spoken language to text, and key phrase extraction would identify important terms, but neither provides the required language conversion.

Microsoft Learn documentation:
- https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/ai-services/language-service/overview
- https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/ai-services/language-service/sentiment-opinion-mining/overview
- https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/training/modules/analyze-text-ai-language/

questions.title: Question 39
questions.question_text: You are developing a chatbot for a website, and need to implement a requirement that the chatbot must answer user's questions based on the information in the following documents: - A frequently asked questions (FAQ) list on a PDF file - A product troubleshooting guide in a Microsoft Word document - A frequently asked questions (FAQ) list on a webpage Which service should you use to process the documents?
questions.question_html:
You are developing a chatbot for a website, and need to implement a requirement that the chatbot must answer user's questions based on the information in the following documents:

- A frequently asked questions (FAQ) list on a PDF file

- A product troubleshooting guide in a Microsoft Word document

- A frequently asked questions (FAQ) list on a webpage

Which service should you use to process the documents?
questions.answer_html:
• A. QnA Maker
  • B. Language Understanding
  • C. Azure Bot Service
  • D. Text Analytics
questions.explanation_en:
You need the chatbot to answer user questions based on the content of an existing web page or document. The classic Azure solution is QnA Maker, now the Question Answering feature in Azure AI Language, which can ingest web pages or documents and build a knowledge base of question–answer pairs. The bot can then query this service to generate answers. Bot Service handles the conversation channel, but QnA Maker processes the documents for Q&A.

Microsoft Learn documentation:
- https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/ai-services/language-service/question-answering/overview
- https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/training/modules/create-question-answer-solution-ai-language/
- https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/bot-service/bot-service-channels-reference?view=azure-bot-service-4.0

questions.title: Question 40

questions.explanation_en:
The matching question asks you to pair different AI workload types—such as artificial intelligence, machine learning, and deep learning—with their descriptions. Machine learning refers to techniques that enable machines to improve at tasks with experience. Deep learning uses multi-layer neural networks for more complex use cases. Artificial intelligence is the broadest term for techniques that enable computers to mimic human intelligence, which includes both machine learning and deep learning.

questions.title: Question 41
questions.question_text: 'Translating speech from one language to another' is a scenario of Conversational Al. Select the correct option.
questions.question_html: 'Translating speech from one language to another' is a scenario of Conversational Al. Select the correct option.
questions.answer_html:
• A. True
  • B. False
questions.explanation_en:
Translating speech from one language to another is primarily a speech and translation workload, not a conversational AI scenario. Conversational AI focuses on managing a back‑and‑forth dialog with users through bots or agents. In this case the system is simply converting spoken language between languages, so the statement that it is a conversational AI scenario is false.

Microsoft Learn documentation:
- https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/credentials/certifications/resources/study-guides/ai-900
- https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/training/paths/introduction-to-ai-on-azure/

questions.title: Question 43
questions.question_text: While presenting at a conference, your session is transcribed into subtitles for the audience in real time. This is an example of which of the following services?
questions.question_html: While presenting at a conference, your session is transcribed into subtitles for the audience in real time. This is an example of which of the following services?
questions.answer_html:
• A. sentiment analysis
  • B. speech recognition
  • C. speech synthesis
  • D. translation
questions.explanation_en:
Real‑time subtitles for a conference session are produced by converting the speaker's audio into text. That is exactly the role of speech recognition (speech‑to‑text). Sentiment analysis works on the emotional tone of text, speech synthesis converts text to speech, and translation moves text between languages, but only speech recognition listens to audio and outputs text subtitles.

Microsoft Learn documentation:
- https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/ai-services/language-service/overview
- https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/ai-services/language-service/sentiment-opinion-mining/overview
- https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/training/modules/analyze-text-ai-language/

questions.title: Question 44
questions.question_text: Your company wants to build a recycling machine for cans. The recycling machine must automatically identify cans of the correct shape and reject all other items. Which type of Al workload should the company use?
questions.question_html: Your company wants to build a recycling machine for cans. The recycling machine must automatically identify cans of the correct shape and reject all other items. Which type of Al workload should the company use?
questions.answer_html:
• A. computer vision
  • B. anomaly detection
  • C. natural language processing
  • D. conversational Al
questions.explanation_en:
The recycling machine must look at physical items and decide whether they are cans of the correct shape. This is an image understanding problem, so it uses a computer vision workload. Anomaly detection is for unusual patterns in numeric data, natural language processing is for text, and conversational AI is for dialog systems, none of which match the requirement to visually inspect items.

Microsoft Learn documentation:
- https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/ai-services/anomaly-detector/overview
- https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/ai-services/metrics-advisor/overview
- https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/ai-services/computer-vision/overview

questions.title: Question 45
questions.question_text: "Detecting spam in emails" is a scenario of Conversational Al. Select the correct option.
questions.question_html: "Detecting spam in emails" is a scenario of Conversational Al. Select the correct option.
questions.answer_html:
• A. True
  • B. False
questions.explanation_en:
Detecting spam in emails is a text classification problem, not a conversational AI scenario. The system analyses message content and metadata and assigns labels such as 'spam' or 'not spam'. It does not hold a conversation with the user, so although it uses AI and natural language processing, it is not considered conversational AI.

Microsoft Learn documentation:
- https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/training/modules/train-evaluate-classification-models/

questions.title: Question 46
questions.question_text: What are Large Language Models? Select the correct option.
questions.question_html: What are Large Language Models? Select the correct option.
questions.answer_html:
• A. Models that use deep learning to process and understand natural language on a massive scale.
  • B. Models that only work with small amounts of data.
  • C. Models that only work with one language.

choices.label: A
choices.text: Models that use deep learning to process and understand natural language on a massive scale.
choices.raw: A. Models that use deep learning to process and understand natural language on a massive scale.

choices.label: B
choices.text: Models that only work with small amounts of data.
choices.raw: B. Models that only work with small amounts of data.

choices.label: C
choices.text: Models that only work with one language.
choices.raw: C. Models that only work with one language.

questions.explanation_en:
Large language models are deep learning models trained on very large text datasets so that they can understand and generate natural language at scale. They can perform many tasks such as answering questions, drafting content, and writing code. They are not limited to small amounts of data or to a single language, so those other options are incorrect.

Microsoft Learn documentation:
- https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/credentials/certifications/resources/study-guides/ai-900
- https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/training/paths/introduction-to-ai-on-azure/

questions.title: Question 47
questions.question_text: What is used to extract dates, quantities, and locations from text. Select the answer that correctly completes the sentence.
questions.question_html: What is used to extract dates, quantities, and locations from text. Select the answer that correctly completes the sentence.
questions.answer_html:
• A. Key phrase extraction
  • B. Sentiment analysis
  • C. Named Entity Recognition (NER)
questions.explanation_en:
Extracting items such as dates, quantities, and locations from text is the role of named entity recognition (NER). NER identifies spans of text and labels them with types like Date, Quantity, or Location. Key phrase extraction finds important topics, and sentiment analysis gauges positive or negative tone, but neither one extracts specific entities with their semantic types.

Microsoft Learn documentation:
- https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/ai-services/language-service/overview
- https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/ai-services/language-service/sentiment-opinion-mining/overview
- https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/training/modules/analyze-text-ai-language/

questions.title: Question 48
questions.question_text: Which Computer Vision feature can you use to generate automatic captions for digital photographs? Select the correct option.
questions.question_html: Which Computer Vision feature can you use to generate automatic captions for digital photographs? Select the correct option.
questions.answer_html:
• A. Detect objects
  • B. Recognize text
  • C. Describe the images
  • D. Identify the areas of interest

choices.label: D
choices.raw: D. Identify the areas of interest

questions.explanation_en:
Generating automatic captions for photographs requires the service to produce a short natural‑language description of the entire image. The 'Describe image' feature of Computer Vision is designed for this: it outputs one or more sentences summarising what is shown. Object detection finds individual objects, text recognition reads text, and 'areas of interest' highlight regions, but they do not create full captions.

Microsoft Learn documentation:
- https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/ai-services/computer-vision/overview
- https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/ai-services/computer-vision/overview-image-analysis

questions.title: Question 49
questions.question_text: Automated Machine Learning is the process of automating the time consuming, iterative tasks of machine learning model development. Select the correct option.
questions.question_html: Automated Machine Learning is the process of automating the time consuming, iterative tasks of machine learning model development. Select the correct option.
questions.answer_html:
• A. True
  • B. False
questions.explanation_en:
Automated machine learning (AutoML) is explicitly defined as automating many of the time‑consuming, iterative steps of model development. It tries different algorithms and hyperparameters, evaluates each run, and ranks models according to your chosen metric. That matches the statement in the question, so the correct answer is that it is true.

Microsoft Learn documentation:
- https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/machine-learning/concept-automated-ml?view=azureml-api-2
- https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/machine-learning/how-to-use-automated-ml-for-ml-models?view=azureml-api-2

Predict how many minutes late a flight will arrive based on the amount of snowfall at an airport.


Segment customers into different groups to support a marketing department.


Predict whether a student will complete a university course.

Type

Regression
Clustering
Classification
questions.explanation_en:
This matching question covers the three main types of machine learning. Classification is used to predict categorical labels such as 'spam' or 'not spam'. Regression predicts continuous numeric values such as sales or temperatures. Clustering groups similar items together without predefined labels. Each scenario must be paired with the appropriate learning type based on whether it predicts categories, numbers, or groupings.

Microsoft Learn documentation:
- https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/training/modules/train-evaluate-classification-models/
- https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/machine-learning/tutorial-designer-automobile-price-train-score?view=azureml-api-1

questions.title: Question 51
questions.question_text: You plan to use Azure Cognitive Services to develop a voice controlled personal assistant app. Match the Azure Cognitive Services to the appropriate tasks.
questions.question_html: You plan to use Azure Cognitive Services to develop a voice controlled personal assistant app. Match the Azure Cognitive Services to the appropriate tasks.
questions.answer_html:
Azure Cognitive Services

Speech
Language service
Translator Text

Answer Area

Tasks

Provide a spoken response to the user.


Convert a user's speech to text.


Identify a user's intent.

Azure Cognitive Service

Speech
Speech
Language service
questions.explanation_en:
A voice‑controlled personal assistant typically uses several cognitive services together. Speech‑to‑text recognises what the user says, language understanding (for example LUIS or Azure AI Language) identifies the user’s intent and extracts entities, and text‑to‑speech generates spoken responses. The hot area question asks you to map each of these tasks to the correct Azure Cognitive Service capability.

Microsoft Learn documentation:
- https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/credentials/certifications/resources/study-guides/ai-900
- https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/training/paths/introduction-to-ai-on-azure/

questions.title: Question 52
questions.question_text: Match the tool to the Azure Machine Learning task.
questions.question_html: Match the tool to the Azure Machine Learning task.
questions.answer_html:
Azure Machine Learning tasks

Automated machine learning
Machine learning designer
The Azure Portal

Answer Area

Tools

Use a wizard to select configurations for a machine learning run.


Create a Machine learning workspace.


Use a drag-and-drop interface used to train and deploy models.

Azure Machine Learning task

Automated machine learning
The Azure Portal
Machine learning designer
questions.explanation_en:
Different Azure Machine Learning tools are suited to different tasks. Designer lets you build and run pipelines visually by dragging and connecting modules. Automated ML lets you specify a dataset and target column and then automatically explores algorithms and hyperparameters to find a good model. Notebooks provide a code‑first experience for custom experiments. In the matching question each task (such as 'build a model with no code' or 'run custom Python code') should be matched to the tool that best supports it.
