questions.title: Question 53
questions.question_text: You need to build an app that will read recipe instructions to support users who have reduced vision. Which version service should you use?
questions.question_html: You need to build an app that will read recipe instructions to support users who have reduced vision. Which version service should you use?
questions.answer_html:
• A. Speech
  • B. Text Analytics
  • C. Translator
  • D. Language Understanding (LUIS)
questions.explanation_en:
In this scenario the app must read recipe instructions aloud for users with reduced vision. That is a text‑to‑speech problem provided by the Speech service. The app converts written instructions into spoken audio. Text Analytics analyses text, Translator changes languages, and Language Understanding identifies intents, but none of those functions actually speak the text to the user.

Microsoft Learn documentation:
- https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/ai-services/language-service/overview
- https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/ai-services/language-service/sentiment-opinion-mining/overview
- https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/training/modules/analyze-text-ai-language/

questions.title: Question 54
questions.question_text: You want to create a model to predict sales of ice cream based on historic data that includes daily ice cream sales totals and weather measurements. Which Azure service should you use?
questions.question_html: You want to create a model to predict sales of ice cream based on historic data that includes daily ice cream sales totals and weather measurements. Which Azure service should you use?
questions.answer_html:
• A. Azure Machine Learning
  • B. Language
  • C. Azure Bot
questions.explanation_en:
Predicting future ice‑cream sales from historic sales and weather measurements is a supervised learning forecasting problem that requires a trained model. Azure Machine Learning is the platform for building, training, and deploying such models. Language and Azure Bot Service focus on natural language and conversational workloads, not on training numeric prediction models.

Microsoft Learn documentation:
- https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/machine-learning/tutorial-designer-automobile-price-train-score?view=azureml-api-1

questions.title: Question 55
questions.question_text: Which service you should use to train an object detection model by using your own images? Select the correct option.
questions.question_html: Which service you should use to train an object detection model by using your own images? Select the correct option.
questions.answer_html:
• A. Computer Vision
  • B. Form Recognizer
  • C. Custom Vision
questions.explanation_en:
To train an object detection model using your own images you need a service that supports custom vision training. Azure Custom Vision lets you upload and label your images and then train either classification or object detection models tailored to your scenario. The base Computer Vision service exposes only prebuilt models and does not train custom ones, and Form Recognizer and Text Analytics are for documents and text, not image object detection.

Microsoft Learn documentation:
- https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/ai-services/document-intelligence/overview?view=doc-intel-4.0.0
- https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/training/modules/work-form-recognizer/
- https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/ai-services/language-service/overview

questions.title: Question 56
questions.question_text: Which of these methods is used to generate additional features? Select the correct option.
questions.question_html: Which of these methods is used to generate additional features? Select the correct option.
questions.answer_html:
• A. Model evaluation
  • B. Feature engineering
  • C. Feature selection
  • D. Model training
questions.explanation_en:
Feature engineering is the process used to generate additional features from existing data, such as combining columns, extracting date components, or encoding categories. These engineered features can help models learn more useful patterns. Feature selection chooses a subset of existing features, model training fits the model, and model evaluation measures performance, but none of those create new features.

Microsoft Learn documentation:
- https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/credentials/certifications/resources/study-guides/ai-900
- https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/training/paths/introduction-to-ai-on-azure/

questions.title: Question 57
questions.question_text: Automated machine learning can automatically infer the training data from the usecase provided. Select the correct option.
questions.question_html: Automated machine learning can automatically infer the training data from the usecase provided. Select the correct option.
questions.answer_html:
• A. True
  • B. False
questions.explanation_en:
Automated machine learning still requires you to provide a prepared training dataset with features and labels. It cannot infer the training data just from the business problem description. AutoML automates model and hyperparameter selection on the data you supply, so the statement that it automatically infers the training data from the use case is false.

Microsoft Learn documentation:
- https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/machine-learning/concept-automated-ml?view=azureml-api-2
- https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/machine-learning/how-to-use-automated-ml-for-ml-models?view=azureml-api-2

questions.title: Question 58
questions.question_text: You use Azure Machine Learning designer to publish an inference pipeline. Which parameters should you use to access the web service? Select two correct option.
questions.question_html: You use Azure Machine Learning designer to publish an inference pipeline. Which parameters should you use to access the web service? Select two correct option.
questions.answer_html:
• A. the REST endpoint
  • B. the training endpoint
  • C. the model name
  • D. the authentication key
questions.explanation_en:
When you publish an inference pipeline as a web service, you call it via its REST endpoint and authenticate using the service's key or token. The training endpoint is used for training pipelines, and the model name is part of the configuration but is not required to call the web service. Therefore the two parameters you must use are the REST endpoint and the authentication key.

Microsoft Learn documentation:
- https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/ai-services/language-service/overview
- https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/ai-services/language-service/sentiment-opinion-mining/overview
- https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/training/modules/analyze-text-ai-language/

questions.title: Question 59
questions.question_text: You are building a QnA Maker bot by using a frequently asked questions (FAQ) page, and need to add professional greetings and other responses to make the bot more user friendly. What should you do?
questions.question_html: You are building a QnA Maker bot by using a frequently asked questions (FAQ) page, and need to add professional greetings and other responses to make the bot more user friendly. What should you do?
questions.answer_html:
• A. Enable active learning
  • B. Create multi-turn questions
  • C. Increase the confidence threshold of responses
  • D. Add chit-chat

choices.label: C
choices.text: Increase the confidence threshold of responses
choices.raw: C. Increase the confidence threshold of responses

questions.explanation_en:
To make a QnA Maker bot more friendly with greetings and small‑talk responses you add the built‑in 'chit‑chat' personality. Chit‑chat provides predefined answers to conversational phrases such as 'hello' or 'thanks'. Active learning improves the coverage of question variations, multi‑turn questions handle dialog flows, and confidence thresholds control when to answer or not, but they do not themselves add friendly greetings.

Microsoft Learn documentation:
- https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/ai-services/language-service/question-answering/overview
- https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/training/modules/create-question-answer-solution-ai-language/
- https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/bot-service/bot-service-channels-reference?view=azure-bot-service-4.0

questions.title: Question 60
questions.question_text: What is the purpose of vector-based embeddings? Select the correct option.
questions.question_html: What is the purpose of vector-based embeddings? Select the correct option.
questions.answer_html:
• A. To correct misspellings in the training data.
  • B. To represent semantic meaning of text tokens.
  • C. To create tokens that include multiple representations of a word in different languages.

choices.label: A
choices.text: To correct misspellings in the training data.
choices.raw: A. To correct misspellings in the training data.

choices.label: B
choices.text: To represent semantic meaning of text tokens.
choices.raw: B. To represent semantic meaning of text tokens.

choices.label: C
choices.text: To create tokens that include multiple representations of a word in different languages.
choices.raw: C. To create tokens that include multiple representations of a word in different languages.

questions.explanation_en:
Vector‑based embeddings are used to represent the semantic meaning of text tokens, words, sentences, or documents as numeric vectors in a high‑dimensional space. In that space, semantically similar texts have vectors that are close together. This enables semantic search, clustering, and similarity comparisons. They are not primarily for correcting misspellings or storing multiple language variants of a word.

Microsoft Learn documentation:
- https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/ai-foundry/openai/concepts/understand-embeddings
- https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/ai-foundry/openai/tutorials/embeddings

questions.title: Question 61
questions.question_text: Select the correct options for OpenAl code generation capability.
questions.question_html: Select the correct options for OpenAl code generation capability.
questions.answer_html:
• A. GPT can convert a function from one programming language into another.
  • B. GPT can explain SQL queries or tables.
  • C. GPT can't write unit tests for our function.
  • D. GPT can summarize functions that are already written.
  • E. GPT models can help developers code faster.

choices.label: A
choices.text: GPT can convert a function from one programming language into another.
choices.raw: A. GPT can convert a function from one programming language into another.

choices.label: B
choices.text: GPT can explain SQL queries or tables.
choices.raw: B. GPT can explain SQL queries or tables.

choices.label: C
choices.text: GPT can't write unit tests for our function.
choices.raw: C. GPT can't write unit tests for our function.

choices.label: D
choices.text: GPT can summarize functions that are already written.
choices.raw: D. GPT can summarize functions that are already written.

choices.label: E
choices.text: GPT models can help developers code faster.
choices.raw: E. GPT models can help developers code faster.

questions.explanation_en:
GPT‑based models can help with many aspects of coding. They can convert code from one language to another, explain SQL queries or database tables, summarise existing functions, and even write unit tests and boilerplate code. All of these capabilities help developers work faster and more productively, so statements that GPT cannot write tests are incorrect while the others are correct.

Microsoft Learn documentation:
- https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/ai-foundry/openai/overview

questions.title: Question 62
questions.question_text: You are using Azure Machine Learning designer to build a model that will predict automobile prices. Which type of modules should you use to complete the model?
questions.question_html: You are using Azure Machine Learning designer to build a model that will predict automobile prices. Which type of modules should you use to complete the model?
questions.answer_html:
• A. 1 - Split Data, 2 - Summarize Data, 3 - Linear Regression
  • B. 1 - Split Data, 2 - Convert to CSV, 3 - K-Means Clustering
  • C. 1 - Select columns in Dataset, 2 - Split Data, 3 - Linear Regression

choices.label: A
choices.text: 1 - Split Data, 2 - Summarize Data, 3 - Linear Regression
choices.raw: A. 1 - Split Data, 2 - Summarize Data, 3 - Linear Regression

choices.label: B
choices.text: 1 - Split Data, 2 - Convert to CSV, 3 - K-Means Clustering
choices.raw: B. 1 - Split Data, 2 - Convert to CSV, 3 - K-Means Clustering

choices.label: C
choices.text: 1 - Select columns in Dataset, 2 - Split Data, 3 - Linear Regression
choices.raw: C. 1 - Select columns in Dataset, 2 - Split Data, 3 - Linear Regression

questions.explanation_en:
To build a model that predicts automobile prices, you should first select the relevant columns from the dataset, then split the data into training and test sets, and finally apply a regression algorithm such as Linear Regression. This corresponds to using 'Select Columns in Dataset', then 'Split Data', then 'Linear Regression' in Designer. Converting to CSV is unnecessary inside the pipeline, and clustering is not suitable for predicting continuous prices.

Microsoft Learn documentation:
- https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/ai-services/language-service/overview
- https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/ai-services/language-service/sentiment-opinion-mining/overview
- https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/training/modules/analyze-text-ai-language/

questions.title: Question 63
questions.question_text: You have an app that identifies birds in images. The app performs the following tasks: - Identifies the location of the birds in the image - Identifies the species of the birds in the image Which type of computer vision does each task use? Locate the birds _________ Identify the species of the birds ________
questions.question_html:
You have an app that identifies birds in images. The app performs the following tasks:

- Identifies the location of the birds in the image

- Identifies the species of the birds in the image

Which type of computer vision does each task use?

Locate the birds _________

Identify the species of the birds ________
questions.answer_html:
• A. Object detection, Image classification
  • B. Object detection, Optical character recognition (OCR)
  • C. Optical character recognition (OCR), Image classification
  • D. Image classification, Object detection

choices.label: B
choices.raw: B. Object detection, Optical character recognition (OCR)

choices.label: C
choices.raw: C. Optical character recognition (OCR), Image classification

questions.explanation_en:
Locating birds within an image requires object detection, which returns bounding boxes around each detected bird. Identifying the species of each bird is an image classification task that assigns a class label such as 'sparrow' or 'eagle'. OCR only reads text, so the correct pairing is object detection for localisation and image classification for species recognition.

Microsoft Learn documentation:
- https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/ai-services/custom-vision-service/overview
- https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/ai-services/custom-vision-service/getting-started-build-a-classifier
- https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/ai-services/computer-vision/overview

questions.title: Question 64
questions.question_text: From the use-cases listed below, select the correct use-case of anomaly detection.
questions.question_html: From the use-cases listed below, select the correct use-case of anomaly detection.
questions.answer_html:
Answer Area

Statement

Yes

No

Forecasting housing prices based on historical data is an example of anomaly detection.

Identifying suspicious sign-ins by looking for deviations from usual patterns is an example of anomaly detection.

Predicting whether a patient will develop diabetes based on the patient's medical history is an example of anomaly detection.
questions.explanation_en:
Anomaly detection is used to find unusual events or patterns that differ significantly from normal behaviour. Forecasting housing prices and predicting whether a patient will develop diabetes are standard regression and classification problems, not anomaly detection. Identifying suspicious sign‑ins by looking for deviations from a user's usual sign‑in patterns is the true example of anomaly detection in this set of statements.

Microsoft Learn documentation:
- https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/ai-services/anomaly-detector/overview
- https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/ai-services/metrics-advisor/overview
- https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/training/modules/train-evaluate-classification-models/

questions.title: Question 65
questions.question_text: During the process of Machine Learning, when should you review evaluation metrics. Select the correct option.
questions.question_html: During the process of Machine Learning, when should you review evaluation metrics. Select the correct option.
questions.answer_html:
• A. Before you train a model.
  • B. After you test a model on the validation data.
  • C. After you clean the data.
  • D. Before you choose the type of model.

choices.label: A
choices.raw: A. Before you train a model.

choices.label: B
choices.text: After you test a model on the validation data.
choices.raw: B. After you test a model on the validation data.

choices.label: C
choices.raw: C. After you clean the data.

choices.label: D
choices.text: Before you choose the type of model.
choices.raw: D. Before you choose the type of model.

questions.explanation_en:
You review evaluation metrics after you have trained the model and tested it on validation or test data. At that point metrics such as accuracy, precision, recall, AUC, or RMSE show how well the model generalises to unseen examples. Looking at metrics before training, right after cleaning data, or before choosing a model type does not give you a meaningful view of model performance.

Microsoft Learn documentation:
- https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/machine-learning/component-reference/evaluate-model?view=azureml-api-2

questions.title: Question 66
questions.question_text: You are designing an Al solution to monitor meetings. The Al model should be able to indicate when people are happy or sad using their facial expressions. Which cognitive service should you use for the solution?
questions.question_html: You are designing an Al solution to monitor meetings. The Al model should be able to indicate when people are happy or sad using their facial expressions. Which cognitive service should you use for the solution?
questions.answer_html:
• A. Text Analytics
  • B. Face API
  • C. Computer Vision
  • D. Speech-to-text
questions.explanation_en:
The solution must analyse people's facial expressions in meetings to determine whether they are happy or sad. This is a face analysis scenario, which is handled by the Face API in Azure Cognitive Services. Face API detects faces and can return attributes like head pose or, in exam objectives, emotions. Text Analytics and Speech‑to‑text work with text and audio, and generic Computer Vision does not specialise in facial attribute analysis.

Microsoft Learn documentation:
- https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/ai-services/language-service/overview
- https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/ai-services/language-service/sentiment-opinion-mining/overview
- https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/training/modules/analyze-text-ai-language/

questions.title: Question 67
questions.question_text: You have been provided following dataset of employees: Income Postcode Income Range 25000 2000 Low 32000 2002 Medium 95000 2000 High You have to use the dataset to train a model that will Income range of employee. Confirm that Income is a _______ Income Range is a ________
questions.question_html:
You have been provided following dataset of employees:

Income Postcode Income Range
25000 2000 Low
32000 2002 Medium
95000 2000 High

You have to use the dataset to train a model that will Income range of employee.

Confirm that Income is a _______

Income Range is a ________
questions.answer_html:
• A. Label, Label
  • B. Feature, Feature
  • C. Label, Feature
  • D. Feature, Label
questions.explanation_en:
In the given dataset Income is the numeric input used to predict the Income Range category. That makes Income a feature and Income Range the label. Features are the variables the model learns from, while the label is the target value or class that the model is trained to predict.

Microsoft Learn documentation:

- https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/training/paths/introduction-to-ai-on-azure/

questions.title: Question 68
questions.question_text: Automated Machine Learning works by running multiple training iterations that are scored and ranked by the metrics you specify. Select the correct option.
questions.question_html: Automated Machine Learning works by running multiple training iterations that are scored and ranked by the metrics you specify. Select the correct option.
questions.answer_html:
• A. True
  • B. False
questions.explanation_en:
Automated Machine Learning works by running multiple training iterations with different algorithms and hyperparameters, scoring each run using the metrics you specify, and ranking the resulting models. This automated search process is what allows AutoML to find a strong model without you manually trying every combination, so the statement in the question is true.

Microsoft Learn documentation:
- https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/machine-learning/concept-automated-ml?view=azureml-api-2
- https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/machine-learning/how-to-use-automated-ml-for-ml-models?view=azureml-api-2

questions.title: Question 69
questions.question_text: Predicting how many vehicles will travel across a bridge on a given day is an example of what type of machine learning? Select the correct option.
questions.question_html: Predicting how many vehicles will travel across a bridge on a given day is an example of what type of machine learning? Select the correct option.
questions.answer_html:
• A. classification
  • B. regression
  • C. clustering
questions.explanation_en:
Predicting how many vehicles will travel across a bridge on a given day is forecasting a numeric quantity. That makes it a regression problem. Classification would predict discrete categories such as 'light', 'medium', or 'heavy' traffic, and clustering would group similar days together without predicting a specific number, so regression is the correct learning type.

Microsoft Learn documentation:
- https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/training/modules/train-evaluate-classification-models/
- https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/machine-learning/tutorial-designer-automobile-price-train-score?view=azureml-api-1

questions.title: Question 70
questions.question_text: You are setting up a webchat bot, that provides responses from a QnA Maker knowledge base. You have been provided with following use case: Use case: Ensure that the bot uses user feedback to improve the relevance of the responses over time. What should you use?
questions.question_html:
You are setting up a webchat bot, that provides responses from a QnA Maker knowledge base. You have been provided with following use case:
Use case:

Ensure that the bot uses user feedback to improve the relevance of the responses over time.

What should you use?
questions.answer_html:
• A. Sentiment analysis
  • B. Active learning
  • C. Business logic
  • D. Key phrase extraction
questions.explanation_en:
Active learning in QnA Maker and Azure AI Language uses user interactions and feedback to suggest new alternative questions and improve the relevance of answers over time. Enabling active learning allows the bot to learn from real user queries and refine the knowledge base. Sentiment analysis, business logic, and key phrase extraction do not automatically adjust QnA content based on user feedback.

Microsoft Learn documentation:
- https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/ai-services/language-service/overview
- https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/ai-services/language-service/sentiment-opinion-mining/overview
- https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/training/modules/analyze-text-ai-language/

questions.title: Question 71
questions.question_text: You are developing a natural language processing solution in Azure for following use case: The solution should analyze customer reviews and determine how positive or negative each review is This is an example of which type of natural language processing workload?
questions.question_html:
You are developing a natural language processing solution in Azure for following use case:
The solution should analyze customer reviews and determine how positive or negative each review is
This is an example of which type of natural language processing workload?
questions.answer_html:
• A. key phrase extraction
  • B. sentiment analysis
  • C. language detection
  • D. entity recognition
questions.explanation_en:
The solution must analyse customer reviews and determine how positive or negative each review is. That is sentiment analysis, which scores text on a positive–negative or similar sentiment scale. Key phrase extraction finds important terms, language detection identifies the language, and entity recognition finds entities, but none of those directly assess positivity versus negativity.

Microsoft Learn documentation:
- https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/ai-services/language-service/overview
- https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/ai-services/language-service/sentiment-opinion-mining/overview
- https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/training/modules/analyze-text-ai-language/

questions.title: Question 72
questions.question_text: For each of the following statement, select Yes if the statement is true. Otherwise, select No. Note: Each correct selection is worth one point. Hot Area:
questions.question_html:
For each of the following statement, select Yes if the statement is true. Otherwise, select No.

Note: Each correct selection is worth one point.

Hot Area:
questions.answer_html:
Answer Area

Statement

Yes

No

You train a regression model by using unlabeled data.

The classification technique is used to predict sequential numerical data over time.

Grouping items by their common characteristics is an example of clustering.
questions.explanation_en:
This hot area question compares regression, classification, and clustering. Regression models require labelled numeric target values, so the statement that you train a regression model on unlabeled data is false. Classification predicts class labels, not sequential numeric time‑series data, so that statement is also false. Grouping items by their common characteristics is exactly what clustering does, so that statement is true.

Microsoft Learn documentation:
- https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/training/modules/train-evaluate-classification-models/
- https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/machine-learning/tutorial-designer-automobile-price-train-score?view=azureml-api-1

questions.title: Question 73
questions.question_text: According to which Microsoft's principle of responsible Al, Al system should not reflect biases from the data sets that are used to train the systems. Select the correct option.
questions.question_html: According to which Microsoft's principle of responsible Al, Al system should not reflect biases from the data sets that are used to train the systems. Select the correct option.
questions.answer_html:
• A. inclusiveness
  • B. privacy and security
  • C. fairness
  • D. accountability
questions.explanation_en:
The Microsoft responsible AI principle that says AI systems should not reflect unfair biases from their training data is Fairness. Fairness focuses on ensuring that AI systems treat individuals and groups equitably. Inclusiveness is about making systems usable by people with diverse abilities, privacy and security protect data, and accountability ensures there is human responsibility for AI systems.

Microsoft Learn documentation:
- https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/machine-learning/concept-responsible-ai?view=azureml-api-2
- https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/training/modules/apply-responsible-ai-principles/

questions.title: Question 74
questions.question_text: How are ChatGPT, OpenAl, and Azure OpenAl related? Select the correct option.
questions.question_html: How are ChatGPT, OpenAl, and Azure OpenAl related? Select the correct option.
questions.answer_html:
• A. Azure OpenAl is Microsoft's version of ChatGPT, a chatbot that uses generative Al models.
  • B. ChatGPT and OpenAl are chatbots that generate natural language, code, and images. Azure OpenAl provides access to these two chatbots.
  • C. OpenAl is a research company that developed ChatGPT, a chatbot that uses generative Al models. Azure OpenAl provides access to many of OpenAl's Al models.

choices.label: A
choices.text: Azure OpenAl is Microsoft's version of ChatGPT, a chatbot that uses generative Al models.
choices.raw: A. Azure OpenAl is Microsoft's version of ChatGPT, a chatbot that uses generative Al models.

choices.label: B
choices.text: ChatGPT and OpenAl are chatbots that generate natural language, code, and images. Azure OpenAl provides access to these two chatbots.
choices.raw: B. ChatGPT and OpenAl are chatbots that generate natural language, code, and images. Azure OpenAl provides access to these two chatbots.

choices.label: C
choices.text: OpenAl is a research company that developed ChatGPT, a chatbot that uses generative Al models. Azure OpenAl provides access to many of OpenAl's Al models.
choices.raw: C. OpenAl is a research company that developed ChatGPT, a chatbot that uses generative Al models. Azure OpenAl provides access to many of OpenAl's Al models.

questions.explanation_en:
OpenAI is the research organisation that created ChatGPT, a chatbot based on large language models. Azure OpenAI Service is a Microsoft Azure offering that provides access to many of OpenAI's models, including the GPT family used by ChatGPT, through managed Azure endpoints. So ChatGPT is a specific application built by OpenAI, and Azure OpenAI is the service that lets you use those underlying models in your own apps.

Microsoft Learn documentation:
- https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/ai-foundry/openai/overview

You can use the Translator service to translate text between languages.

You can use the Translator service to detect the language of a given text.

You can use the Translator service to transcribe audible speech into text.
questions.explanation_en:
Azure Translator can translate text between languages and can also detect the language of a given text, so those two statements are true. Transcribing audible speech into text is speech recognition, which is provided by the Speech service, not Translator. In practice you would first use Speech‑to‑text to get text from audio and then Translator to translate it.

questions.title: Question 76
questions.question_text: You have to extract Total and Subtotal from a receipt. Which of the following services should you use?
questions.question_html: You have to extract Total and Subtotal from a receipt. Which of the following services should you use?
questions.answer_html:
• A. Ink recognizer
  • B. Form recognizer
  • C. Custom Vision
  • D. Text analytics
questions.explanation_en:
To extract fields such as Total and Subtotal from a receipt you should use Form Recognizer (now Azure AI Document Intelligence). It provides prebuilt receipt models that can parse receipts and return key fields like totals, taxes, and merchant name. Ink Recognizer focuses on digital ink, Custom Vision on image classification and object detection, and Text Analytics on unstructured text, so they are not suited for structured receipt fields.

Microsoft Learn documentation:
- https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/ai-services/document-intelligence/overview?view=doc-intel-4.0.0
- https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/training/modules/work-form-recognizer/
- https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/ai-services/language-service/overview

questions.title: Question 77
questions.question_text: "Training of a custom image classification model" can be performed by using the Computer Vision service. Select the correct option.
questions.question_html: "Training of a custom image classification model" can be performed by using the Computer Vision service. Select the correct option.
questions.answer_html:
• A. True
  • B. False
questions.explanation_en:
Training a custom image classification model cannot be done with the standard Computer Vision service alone, because it offers only prebuilt models. Custom image classification requires the Custom Vision service, where you upload and label your own images and train a model. Therefore the statement that you can perform this training using the Computer Vision service is false.

Microsoft Learn documentation:
- https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/ai-services/custom-vision-service/overview
- https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/ai-services/custom-vision-service/getting-started-build-a-classifier
- https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/ai-services/computer-vision/overview

questions.title: Question 78
questions.question_text: What extracts text from handwritten documents?
questions.question_html: What extracts text from handwritten documents?
questions.answer_html:
• A. Image classification
  • B. Object detection
  • C. Facial recognition
  • D. Optical character recognition (OCR)
questions.explanation_en:
Extracting text from handwritten documents is an optical character recognition (OCR) task. OCR converts handwritten or printed text in images into machine‑readable text. Image classification recognises entire images, object detection finds objects, and facial recognition identifies people, but none of those read the actual text content.

Microsoft Learn documentation:
- https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/ai-services/custom-vision-service/overview
- https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/ai-services/custom-vision-service/getting-started-build-a-classifier
- https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/ai-services/computer-vision/overview

questions.title: Question 80
questions.question_text: You have to predict the number of gift cards that will be sold next year. Which type of machine learning should you use?
questions.question_html: You have to predict the number of gift cards that will be sold next year. Which type of machine learning should you use?
questions.answer_html:
• A. clustering
  • B. regression
  • C. classification
questions.explanation_en:
You need to predict the number of gift cards that will be sold next year, which is a numeric value. This is a regression problem. Classification would assign cases to categories such as 'high' or 'low' sales, and clustering would group similar customers or time periods without predicting an exact quantity, so regression is the appropriate choice.

Microsoft Learn documentation:
- https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/training/modules/train-evaluate-classification-models/

questions.title: Question 256
questions.question_text: Which principle of responsible artificial intelligence (AI) raises awareness about the limitations of AI-based solutions?
questions.question_html: Which principle of responsible artificial intelligence (AI) raises awareness about the limitations of AI-based solutions?
questions.answer_html:
• A. privacy and security
  • B. transparency
questions.explanation_en:
Transparency provides clarity regarding the purpose of AI solutions, the way they work, as well as their limitations. The privacy and security, reliability and safety, and accountability principles focus on the capabilities of AI, rather than raising awareness about its limitations.

Microsoft Learn documentation:
- https://learn.microsoft.com/training/modules/get-started-ai-fundamentals/8-understand-responsible-ai
- https://learn.microsoft.com/training/paths/responsible-ai-business-principles/

questions.title: Question 262
questions.question_text: Which type of machine learning algorithm groups observations is based on the similarities of features?
questions.question_html: Which type of machine learning algorithm groups observations is based on the similarities of features?
questions.answer_html:
• A. classification
  • B. clustering
questions.explanation_en:
Clustering algorithms group data points that have similar characteristics. Regression algorithms are used to predict numeric values. Classification algorithms are used to predict a predefined category to which an input value belongs. Supervised learning is a category of learning algorithms that includes regression and classification, but not clustering.

Microsoft Learn documentation:
- https://learn.microsoft.com/training/modules/fundamentals-machine-learning/
- https://learn.microsoft.com/training/modules/understand-classification-machine-learning/2-what-is-classification
- https://learn.microsoft.com/training/modules/train-evaluate-cluster-models/2-what-is-clustering

questions.title: Question 263
questions.question_text: Predicting rainfall for a specific geographical location is an example of which type of machine learning?
questions.question_html: Predicting rainfall for a specific geographical location is an example of which type of machine learning?
questions.answer_html:
• A. clustering
  • B. regression
questions.explanation_en:
Predicting rainfall is an example of regression machine learning, as it will predict a numeric value for future rainfall by using historical time-series rainfall data based on factors, such as seasons. Clustering is a machine learning type that analyzes unlabeled data to find similarities in the data. Featurization is not a machine learning type, but a collection of techniques, such as feature engineering, data-scaling, and normalization. Classification is used to predict categories of data.

Microsoft Learn documentation:
- https://learn.microsoft.com/training/modules/fundamentals-machine-learning/4-regression

questions.title: Question 265
questions.question_text: A retailer wants to group together online shoppers that have similar attributes to enable its marketing team to create targeted marketing campaigns for new product launches. Which type of machine learning is this?
questions.question_html: A retailer wants to group together online shoppers that have similar attributes to enable its marketing team to create targeted marketing campaigns for new product launches. Which type of machine learning is this?
questions.answer_html:
• A. classification
  • B. clustering
questions.explanation_en:
Clustering is a machine learning type that analyzes unlabeled data to find similarities present in the data. It then groups (clusters) similar data together. In this example, the company can group online customers based on attributes that include demographic data and shopping behaviors. The company can then recommend new products to those groups of customers who are most likely to be interested in them. Classification and multiclass classification are used to predict categories of data. Regression is a machine learning scenario that is used to predict numeric values.

Microsoft Learn documentation:
- https://learn.microsoft.com/training/modules/fundamentals-machine-learning/4-regression

questions.title: Question 270
questions.question_text: Which three data transformation modules are in the Azure Machine Learning designer? Each correct answer presents a complete solution.
questions.question_html: Which three data transformation modules are in the Azure Machine Learning designer? Each correct answer presents a complete solution.
questions.answer_html:
• A. Clean Missing Data
  • B. Model Evaluate Model
  • C. Normalize Data
  • D. Select Columns in Dataset
questions.explanation_en:
Normalize Data is a data transformation module that is used to change the values of numeric columns in a dataset to a common scale, without distorting differences in the range of values. The Clean Missing Data module is part of preparing the data and data transformation process. Select Columns in Dataset is a data transformation component that is used to choose a subset of columns of interest from a dataset. The train clustering model is not a part of data transformation. The evaluate model is a component used to measure the accuracy of training models.

Microsoft Learn documentation:
- https://learn.microsoft.com/training/modules/fundamentals-machine-learning/7-clustering

questions.title: Question 275
questions.question_text: Which process allows you to use optical character recognition (OCR)?
questions.question_html: Which process allows you to use optical character recognition (OCR)?
questions.answer_html:
• A. translating speech to text
  • B. digitizing medical records
questions.explanation_en:
OCR can extract printed or handwritten text from images. In this case, it can be used to extract text from scanned medical records to produce a digital archive from paper-based documents. Identifying wildlife in an image is an example of a computer vision solution that uses object detection and is not suitable for OCR. Identifying a user requesting access to a laptop is done by taking images from the laptop’s webcam and using facial detection and recognition to identify the user requesting access. Translating speech to text is an example of using speech translation and uses the Azure AI Speech service as part of Azure AI Services.

Microsoft Learn documentation:
- https://learn.microsoft.com/training/modules/read-text-computer-vision/

questions.title: Question 277
questions.question_text: You have a set of images. Each image shows one type of bone fracture. What allows you to identify bone fractures in different X-ray images?
questions.question_html: You have a set of images. Each image shows one type of bone fracture. What allows you to identify bone fractures in different X-ray images?
questions.answer_html:
• A. object detection
  • B. image classification
questions.explanation_en:
Image classification is part of computer vision and can be used to evaluate images from an X-ray machine to quickly classify specific bone fracture types. This helps improve diagnosis and treatment plans. An image classification model is trained to facilitate the categorizing of the bone fractures. Object detection is used to return identified objects in an image, such as a cat, person, or chair. Conversational AI is used to create intelligent bots that can interact with people by using natural language. Facial detection is used to detect the location of human faces in an image.

Microsoft Learn documentation:
- https://learn.microsoft.com/training/modules/analyze-images-computer-vision/2b-computer-vision-models

questions.title: Question 282
questions.question_text: When using the Azure AI Face service, what should you use to perform one-to-many or one-to-one face matching? Each correct answer presents a complete solution.
questions.question_html: When using the Azure AI Face service, what should you use to perform one-to-many or one-to-one face matching? Each correct answer presents a complete solution.
questions.answer_html:
• A. face attributes
  • B. face identification
  • C. face verification
questions.explanation_en:
Face identification in the Azure AI Face service can address one-to-many matching of one face in an image to a set of faces in a secure repository. Face verification has the capability for one-to-one matching of a face in an image to a single face from a secure repository or a photo to verify whether they are the same individual. Face attributes, the find similar faces operation, and Azure AI Custom Vision do not verify the identity of a face.

Microsoft Learn documentation:
- https://learn.microsoft.com/azure/cognitive-services/computer-vision/overview-identity
- https://learn.microsoft.com/training/modules/detect-analyze-faces/

questions.title: Question 284
questions.question_text: What is the first step in the statistical analysis of terms in a text in the context of natural language processing (NLP)?
questions.question_html: What is the first step in the statistical analysis of terms in a text in the context of natural language processing (NLP)?
questions.answer_html:
• A. counting the occurrences of each word
  • B. removing stop words

choices.label: A
choices.text: counting the occurrences of each word
choices.raw: A. counting the occurrences of each word

questions.explanation_en:
Removing stop words is the first step in the statistical analysis of terms used in a text in the context of NLP. Counting the occurrences of each word takes place after stop words are removed. Creating a vectorized model is not part of statistical analysis. It is used to capture the sematic relationship between words. Encoding words as numeric features is not part of statistical analysis. It is frequently used in sentiment analysis.

Microsoft Learn documentation:
- https://learn.microsoft.com/training/modules/analyze-text-with-text-analytics-service/2-understand-text-analytics

questions.title: Question 287
questions.question_text: Which Azure AI Service for Language feature allows you to analyze written articles to extract information and concepts, such as people and locations, for classification purposes?
questions.question_html: Which Azure AI Service for Language feature allows you to analyze written articles to extract information and concepts, such as people and locations, for classification purposes?
questions.answer_html:
• A. Azure AI Content Moderator
  • B. named entity recognition
questions.explanation_en:
Named entity recognition can identify and categorize entities in unstructured text, such as people, places, organizations, and quantities, and is suitable to support the development of an article recommendation system. Key phrase extraction, Content Moderator, and the PII feature are not suited to entity recognition tasks to build a recommender system.

Microsoft Learn documentation:
- https://learn.microsoft.com/azure/cognitive-services/language-service/named-entity-recognition/overview
- https://learn.microsoft.com/training/modules/analyze-text-with-text-analytics-service/

questions.title: Question 289
questions.question_text: Which three features are elements of the Azure AI Language Service? Each correct answer presents a complete solution.
questions.question_html: Which three features are elements of the Azure AI Language Service? Each correct answer presents a complete solution.
questions.answer_html:
• A. Azure AI Vision
  • B. Azure AI Content Moderator
  • C. Sentiment analysis
  • D. Entity Linking
  • E. Personally Identifiable Information (PII) detection
questions.explanation_en:
Entity Linking, PII detection, and sentiment analysis are all elements of the Azure AI Service for Azure AI Language. Azure AI Vision deals with image processing. Azure AI Content Moderator is an Azure AI Services service that is used to check text, image, and video content for material that is potentially offensive.

questions.answer_html:

  • B. creating variations of an image
  • C. new image creation
  • D. editing an image

choices.raw: B. creating variations of an image

questions.explanation_en:
Image generation models can take a prompt, a base image, or both, and create something new. These generative AI models can create both realistic and artistic images, change the layout or style of an image, and create variations of a provided image.

questions.question_text: Select the answer that correctly completes the sentence. [Answer choice] can used to identify constraints and styles for the responses of a generative AI model.

questions.answer_html:

  • B. System messages
questions.explanation_en:

questions.title: Question 299
questions.question_text: Which three sources can be used to generate questions and answers for a knowledge base? Each correct answer presents a complete solution.
questions.question_html: Which three sources can be used to generate questions and answers for a knowledge base? Each correct answer presents a complete solution.
questions.answer_html:
• A. an existing FAQ document
  • B. an image file
  • C. manually entered data
  • D. a webpage
questions.explanation_en:
A webpage or an existing document, such as a text file containing question and answer pairs, can be used to generate a knowledge base. You can also manually enter the knowledge base question-and-answer pairs. You cannot directly use an image or an audio file to import a knowledge base.

questions.title: Question 306
questions.question_text: Which two artificial intelligence (AI) workload scenarios are examples of natural language processing (NLP)? Each correct answer presents a complete solution.
questions.question_html: Which two artificial intelligence (AI) workload scenarios are examples of natural language processing (NLP)? Each correct answer presents a complete solution.
questions.answer_html:
• A. extracting handwritten text from online images
  • B. translating text between different languages from product reviews
  • C. performing sentiment analysis on social media data

choices.label: A
choices.text: extracting handwritten text from online images
choices.raw: A. extracting handwritten text from online images

choices.label: B
choices.text: translating text between different languages from product reviews
choices.raw: B. translating text between different languages from product reviews

choices.label: C
choices.text: performing sentiment analysis on social media data
choices.raw: C. performing sentiment analysis on social media data

questions.explanation_en:
Translating text between different languages from product reviews is an NLP workload that uses the Azure AI Translator service and is part of Azure AI Services. It can provide text translation of supported languages in real time. Performing sentiment analysis on social media data is an NLP that uses the sentiment analysis feature of the Azure AI Service for Language. It can provide sentiment labels, such as negative, neutral, and positive for text-based sentences and documents.

Microsoft Learn documentation:
- https://learn.microsoft.com/training/paths/explore-natural-language-processing/

questions.title: Question 320
questions.question_text: Which three data transformation modules are in the Azure Machine Learning designer? Each correct answer presents a complete solution.
questions.question_html: Which three data transformation modules are in the Azure Machine Learning designer? Each correct answer presents a complete solution.
questions.answer_html:
• A. Clean Missing Data
  • B. Model Evaluate Model
  • C. Select Columns in Dataset
  • D. Normalize Data
questions.explanation_en:
Normalize Data is a data transformation module that is used to change the values of numeric columns in a dataset to a common scale, without distorting differences in the range of values. The Clean Missing Data module is part of preparing the data and data transformation process. Select Columns in Dataset is a data transformation component that is used to choose a subset of columns of interest from a dataset. The train clustering model is not a part of data transformation. The evaluate model is a component used to measure the accuracy of training models.

Microsoft Learn documentation:
- https://learn.microsoft.com/training/modules/fundamentals-machine-learning/7-clustering

questions.title: Question 322
questions.question_text: Which artificial intelligence (AI) technique serves as the foundation for modern image classification solutions?
questions.question_html: Which artificial intelligence (AI) technique serves as the foundation for modern image classification solutions?
questions.answer_html:
• A. semantic segmentation
  • B. deep learning
questions.explanation_en:
Modern image classification solutions are based on deep learning techniques. Semantic segmentation provides the ability to classify individual pixels in an image depending on the object that they represent. Both linear regression and multiple linear regression use training and validating predictions to predict numeric values, so they are not part of image classification solutions.

Microsoft Learn documentation:
- https://learn.microsoft.com/training/modules/analyze-images-computer-vision/2b-computer-vision-models
- https://learn.microsoft.com/training/modules/fundamentals-machine-learning/

questions.title: Question 324
questions.question_text: Which computer vision solution provides the ability to identify a person's age based on a photograph?
questions.question_html: Which computer vision solution provides the ability to identify a person's age based on a photograph?
questions.answer_html:
• A. image classification
  • B. facial detection
questions.explanation_en:
Facial detection provides the ability to detect and analyze human faces in an image, including identifying a person's age based on a photograph. Image classification classifies images based on their contents. Object detection provides the ability to generate bounding boxes identifying the locations of different types of vehicles in an image. Semantic segmentation provides the ability to classify individual pixels in an image.

Microsoft Learn documentation:
- https://learn.microsoft.com/training/modules/analyze-images-computer-vision/2-image-analysis-azure
- https://learn.microsoft.com/training/modules/get-started-ai-fundamentals/4-understand-computer-vision

questions.answer_html:
• A. named entity recognition
  • B. entity linking
questions.explanation_en:
Entity Linking identifies and disambiguates the identity of entities found in a text. Key phrase extraction is not used to extract entities and is used instead to extract key phrases to identify the main concepts in a text. Named entity recognition cannot provide a link for each entity to view further information. Text translation is part of the Azure AI Translator service.

questions.title: Question 351
questions.question_text: Which principle of responsible artificial intelligence (AI) raises awareness about the limitations of AI-based solutions?
questions.question_html: Which principle of responsible artificial intelligence (AI) raises awareness about the limitations of AI-based solutions?
questions.answer_html:
Transparency provides clarity regarding the purpose of AI solutions, the way they work, as well as their limitations. The privacy and security, reliability and safety, and accountability principles focus on the capabilities of AI, rather than raising awareness about its limitations.

Understand Responsible AI - Training | Microsoft Learn

Identify principles and practices for responsible AI - Training | Microsoft Learn

questions.title: Question 352
questions.question_text: Which principle of responsible artificial intelligence (AI) involves evaluating and mitigating the bias introduced by the features of a model?
questions.question_html: Which principle of responsible artificial intelligence (AI) involves evaluating and mitigating the bias introduced by the features of a model?
questions.answer_html:
Fairness involves evaluating and mitigating the bias introduced by the features of a model. Privacy is meant to ensure that privacy provisions are included in AI solutions. Transparency provides clarity regarding the purpose of AI solutions, the way they work, as well as their limitations. Accountability is focused on ensuring that AI solutions meet ethical and legal standards that are clearly defined.

Understand Responsible AI - Training | Microsoft Learn

questions.title: Question 353
questions.question_text: Which principle of responsible artificial intelligence (AI) plays the primary role when implementing an AI solution that meet qualifications for business loan approvals?
questions.question_html: Which principle of responsible artificial intelligence (AI) plays the primary role when implementing an AI solution that meet qualifications for business loan approvals?
questions.answer_html:
Fairness is meant to ensure that AI models do not unintentionally incorporate a bias based on criteria such as gender or ethnicity. Transparency does not apply in this case since banks commonly use their proprietary models when processing loan approvals. Inclusiveness is also out of scope since not everyone is qualified for a loan. Safety is not a primary consideration since there is no direct threat to human life or health in this case.

Understand Responsible AI - Training | Microsoft Learn

Which two issues should be considered as part of the responsible AI principle of fairness to avoid biased decision making? Each correct answer presents part of the solution.
questions.question_html:
A bank is developing a new artificial intelligence (AI) system to support the process of accepting or rejecting mortgage applications.

Which two issues should be considered as part of the responsible AI principle of fairness to avoid biased decision making? Each correct answer presents part of the solution.
questions.answer_html:
The AI system must be designed to ensure that biased decision making is avoided and not based on factors such as ethnicity and gender. The system will consider salary, payment history, and credit utilization. These are standard metrics.

questions.title: Question 355
questions.question_text: Which two principles of responsible artificial intelligence (AI) are most important when designing an AI system to manage healthcare data? Each correct answer presents part of the solution.
questions.question_html: Which two principles of responsible artificial intelligence (AI) are most important when designing an AI system to manage healthcare data? Each correct answer presents part of the solution.
questions.answer_html:
The accountability principle states that AI systems are designed to meet any ethical and legal standards that are applicable. The system must be designed to ensure that privacy of the healthcare data is of the highest importance, including anonymizing data where applicable. The fairness principle is applied to AI systems to ensure that users of the systems are treated fairly. The inclusiveness principle states that AI systems must empower people in a positive and engaging way.

Understand Responsible AI - Training | Microsoft Learn

questions.question_html:
An electricity utility company wants to develop a mobile app for its customers to monitor their energy use and to display their predicted energy use for the next 12 months. The company wants to use machine learning to provide a reasonably accurate prediction of future energy use by using the customers’ previous energy-use data.

Which type of machine learning is this?
questions.answer_html:
Regression is a machine learning scenario that is used to predict numeric values. In this example, regression will be able to predict future energy consumption based on analyzing historical time-series energy data based on factors, such as seasonal weather and holiday periods. Multiclass classification is used to predict categories of data. Clustering analyzes unlabeled data to find similarities present in the data. Classification is used to predict categories of data.

questions.title: Question 360
questions.question_text: A retailer wants to group together online shoppers that have similar attributes to enable its marketing team to create targeted marketing campaigns for new product launches. Which type of machine learning is this?
questions.question_html:
A retailer wants to group together online shoppers that have similar attributes to enable its marketing team to create targeted marketing campaigns for new product launches.

Which type of machine learning is this?
questions.answer_html:
Clustering is a machine learning type that analyzes unlabeled data to find similarities present in the data. It then groups (clusters) similar data together. In this example, the company can group online customers based on attributes that include demographic data and shopping behaviors. The company can then recommend new products to those groups of customers who are most likely to be interested in them. Classification and multiclass classification are used to predict categories of data. Regression is a machine learning scenario that is used to predict numeric values.

questions.explanation_en:
The safety system layer includes platform-level configurations and capabilities that help mitigate harm. For example, the Azure OpenAI service includes support for content filters that apply criteria to suppress prompts and responses based on the classification of content into four severity levels (safe, low, medium, and high) for four categories of potential harm (hate, sexual, violence, and self-harm).
Responsible generative AI - Training | Microsoft Learn

questions.answer_html:
Image description is not a capability included in the DALL-E model, therefore, it is not a use case that can be implemented by using DALL-E, while the other three capabilities are offered by DALL-E in Azure OpenAI.

questions.title: Question 395
questions.question_text: Which generative AI model is used to generate images based on natural language prompts?
questions.question_html: Which generative AI model is used to generate images based on natural language prompts?
questions.answer_html:
DALL-E is a model that can generate images from natural language. GPT-4 and GPT-3.5 can understand and generate natural language and code but not images. Embeddings can convert text into numerical vector form to facilitate text similarity. Whisper can transcribe and translate speech to text.

Azure OpenAI Service models - Azure OpenAI | Microsoft Learn

DALL-E is a model that can generate images from natural language. GPT-4 and GPT-3.5 can understand and generate natural language and code but not images. Embeddings can convert text into numerical vector form to facilitate text similarity. Whisper can transcribe and translate speech to text.
Azure OpenAI Service models - Azure OpenAI | Microsoft Learn
